basics.name: Gaëtan Staquet
basics.label: PhD Student in Theoretical Computer Science

location.address: Bâtiment De Vinci, Avenue Victor Maistriau, 15

education.cvNote: Exchange year at University of Montreal, Canada, in 2017.

work.company: UMONS (University of Mons) and UAntwerpen (University of Antwerp)
work.summary:
Title: Improvement of the state of the art regarding the theory of learning algorithms for automata models extended with resources and its applications to black-box model-checking.
Supervisors: [Véronique Bruyère](http://informatique.umons.ac.be/perso/Bruyere.Veronique/) (UMONS) and [Guillermo A. Perez](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/staff/guillermoalberto-perez/) (UAntwerpen).
[F.R.S.-FNRS](https://www.frs-fnrs.be/en/) Research Fellow.

Title: Efficient Learning of Automata and Automata with One Counter.
Supervisor: [Véronique Bruyère](http://informatique.umons.ac.be/perso/Bruyere.Veronique/) (UMONS). Grade: 19/20.

Implementation of an active learning algorithm for Visibly One-Counter Automata.
Supervisor: [Guillermo A. Perez](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/staff/guillermoalberto-perez/).

Subject: Efficient algorithms for Nash equilibrium computation.
Supervisors: [Aline Goeminne](http://math.umons.ac.be/staff/Goeminne.Aline/), [Thomas Brihaye](http://math.umons.ac.be/maef/fr/tbrihaye.html), [Véronique Bruyère](http://informatique.umons.ac.be/staff/Bruyere.Veronique/), and [Hadrien Mélot](http://informatique.umons.ac.be/staff/Melot.Hadrien/).

conferences.title: Optimization of Answer Set Programs for Consistent Query Answering by Means of First-Order Rewriting
conferences.authors: Aziz Amezian El Khalfioui, Jonathan Joertz, Dorian Labeeuw, Gaëtan Staquet and Jef Wijsen
conferences.conference: 29th ACM International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management (CIKM)

projects.name: Master's Thesis
projects.description:
* Title: _Efficient Learning of Automata and Automata with One Counter_.
 * Supervisor: [Véronique Bruyère](http://informatique.umons.ac.be/perso/Bruyere.Veronique/) (UMONS).

projects.name: LearningVCA
projects.description:
* Implementation of an active automata learning algorithm dedicated to _visibly one-counter automata_.
 * [Original paper by Daniel Neider and Christof Löding, from 2010](http://ftp8.de.freebsd.org/pub/reports/2010/2010-02.pdf).
 * Done during my internship at UAntwerpen, under the supervision of [Guillermo A. Perez](https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/staff/guillermoalberto-perez/).
